name: 運動賽會管理
goals: To understand the importance and contribution of international mega sport events.
To expand students international perspectives of sport events management.
To cultivate students ability of planning and managing the successful sport event and the ability to work with others (team work).
To develop the essential capability of being an outstanding global sport events leader who is able to deal with various challenges and issues successfully in the sport world.
syllabus:
**Week 1：Introduction: (International) Sport event management.**

**Week 2：Philosophy of international mega sport events: The pros and cons of hosting international mega sport events** 

**Week 3：COVID 19 and the future development of sport events.**

**Week 4：Understanding the event organizing structure and human resource management. (Class activity: Organizing  wedding party)**

**Week 5：Financial management and budgeting.**

**Week 6：Sport event marketing I: Discussion of cases.**

**Week 7：Sport event marketing II: Event sponsorship.**

**Week 8：**Guest speech: Mr. Yam, T. C. (Manager, NBA Taiwan)

**Week 9：Sport event risk management and legal issues.**

Week 10: Sport event administrative operation.

Week 11: Sport event services operation.

Week 12: Sport event competition operation.

Week 13: Case studies of sport event planning.

Week 14: Ms. Fran Lin (Founder, GateSports Agency, New York)

Week 15:  Final oral presentations: Sport event proposal I.

Week 16:  Final oral presentations: Sport event proposal II.

**Week 17: Site visit or sport events analysis on the web.**

**Week 18: Site visit** **or sport events analysis on the web.**

methodologies.note: To Introduce the weekly topic by keynote speech
To organize the group discussion/debate based on the related issues
To manage the sport events  by case practices or field practices
To observe the mega sport events (i.e. University Games) or activities (i.e. after games press conference)
To watch the related videos and apply social media skills for concepts enhancement
To do the project research by topic presentations of group team work

grading.note: Reports after event/site visit and assignments after class

prerequisite: ◎Available for junior and senior year B.A. program students (Doctoral program courses excepted) and M.A. program students.
